FRONTIER.Definition: a line or border separating two countries

‍SOVEREIGN.Definition: (of a nation or its affairs) acting or done independently and without outside interference

‍ENSHRINED IN LAW.Definition: preserve (a right, tradition, or idea) in a form that ensures it will be protected and respected

‍GLOSSING OVER.Definition: treat with less attention than it deserves, miss parts of it

‍CANNONBALL.Definition: the bullet or ball fired by a cannon

‍ANOMALIES.Definition: something that is different to what is normal or expected

‍A BODY OF WATER.Definition: a piece or stretch of water

‍DEMARCATE.Definition: set the boundaries or limits of

‍ZERO-SUM.Definition: relating to or denoting a situation in which whatever is gained by one side is lost by the other

‍UNDERMINES.Definition: lessen the effectiveness, power, or ability of, especially gradually or insidiously

‍IMPINGES.Definition: advance over an area belonging to someone or something else; encroach

‍RATIFIED.Definition: sign or give formal consent to (a treaty, contract, or agreement), making it officially valid

‍PIRACY.Definition: the practice of attacking and robbing ships at sea

‍VIOLATING.Definition: break or fail to comply with (a rule or formal agreement)

‍FLARE UP.Definition: a sudden outburst of something, especially violence or hostility

SINGLE OUT.Definition: choose someone or something from a group for special treatment

GIVES YOU THE MEASURE.Definition: helps you understand (normally relating to the character or abilities of someone or something)

ORPHANED.Definition: (of a child) both parents have died

‍TREACLE.Definition: a thick, sticky dark syrup made from partly refined sugar, used here to indicate that there is a lot of bureaucracy

HERITAGE.Definition: valued objects and qualities such as historic buildings and cultural traditions that have been passed down from previous generations
